positive.review:
Good game for it's price. However, it's missing some content to be a truly great game.  

Pros: 
Great music, Touhou games never disappoints in the music department.
Fun combat, gameplay feels smooth and engaging.
Cool animations, watching the same moves over and over doesn't get old.

Cons:
The same few bosses and map gets old after a handful of runs. Would be great if there were some randomizing.
The difficulty increase doesn't feel as rewarding as it is in similar games such as Hades.  
Mediocre translation job, localization to English could use some work.

Overall: 7/10

Tl;dr: Touhou Dystopian is a very good and cheap hack and slash that you should buy.

I'm going to start off this review of Touhou Dystopian with the few negatives it has. First of all, there's nothing particularly special or out there compared to other hack and slashes or character action games, it's fairly simple. No tricks or extremely long, flashy combos you can pull off here. 
It also doesn't have the best performance, I experienced many frame drops during the levels. Not enough to ruin the game, but it was still a disappointment.
Following the performance, it has a "standard good" anime look in that it's more of a stylistic look. Which is more of a continuation of the frame drops con since I don't think there's anything in the game that should really warrant the performance taking a hit.
Finally, there were some bugs that I think got fixed, but a particularly nasty one was when I messed up the timing for my dodge, I got hit, and I lost control of my character until I dashed again. Very bad bug.

With that out of the way, I can now sing the high praise I have for this game (and review).
Touhou Dystopian is a roguelike/lite hack and slash, meaning almost all of the time you spend in this game is spent on gameplay. It's a Touhou game that focuses on gameplay. This in turn means you won't get much of the characters' personalities, something the Touhou fanbase loves to play around with. So let's move onto the gameplay since there's not much in the story/character department.
In Touhou Dystopian, you select 1 of 4 playable chars (Youmu, Flandre, Mokou, and Marisa) potentially take 1 of 4 companions (Koishi, Meiling, Reisen, and Reimu) to go through 3 levels of trash mobs into the next boss, which there are 9 of (Hina, Aya, Suwako, Cirno, Alice, Yuyuko, Patchouli, Sakuya, and Remilia). All of their difference movesets with different unique talents.
Naturally as a roguelike, you have to unlock the other characters, companions, and upgrades. This brings us to the core gameplay loop, you pick a char (Youmu at the start) and you enter the game, you beat up some what appears to be plushies (no joke about the appearance) fight the boss, hopefully beat the boss, get dolls, and upgrade your char, rinse and repeat 9 times. The more bosses you beat, the more dolls you get that then unlock the features of the game. If you beat all 9 bosses, you can "release seal" which means higher difficulties.
The controls are pretty good and responsive. there's only slight button memory, so you won't have it remember input from 5 seconds (cough Dark Souls cough). The dash/dodge to proc the perfect dodge works as one expects, even allowing you to dodge into attacks that completely whiffed you since the bullets are still active hitboxes.
The playstyles are pretty fun between all of them, usually it's 2 main ones (meaning most of the upgrades buff "intended" attacks) with 1 or 2 sub playstyles (meaning on only a few upgrades to buff certain attacks).
The content is certainly not the most jam packed, it ran me about 10+ hours to unlock everything and 100% achievement the game. So, it's instead highly replayable thanks to the randomness and the fact that runs are pretty short, ranging from sub 20 minutes to 40 minutes or so. Only an Extreme Misfortune (the shrine is an unlock that lets you give buffs to you or the enemy) or no upgrades might make it last longer than that.

So what's its main strength? Well, like many good Touhou games, it's not that any particularly one part of the game is strong or mind-blowing, it's that almost all of the aspects are executed good. So if you like hack and slashes and/or roguelike/lites, I'd heavily recommend it. It's $10 which I believe is way underselling. If you truly are on the fence, give the demo a whirl, it even lets you keep some stuff you unlock there!

Fun rouge-like action game that offers a good variety of playstyles. I don't honestly know much about Touhou, but I've enjoyed my time in the setting despite having no background knowledge.

My biggest gripe with the game is that the pacing is really fast. You basically fight 3 short waves of enemies (usually less than a minute each) and then fight a boss for a few minutes. While there are many stages and bosses in a full run, I don't really feel the value of a lot of combat-changing upgrades since non-boss enemies usually die too quickly and boss enemies don't really give you many opportunities to get the most out of upgrades which give you new types of combo-extending attacks (due to hyper armor, etc.). I haven't played the final difficulty mode, so maybe the pacing makes more sense there and non-boss fight feels a bit more engaging, but it hasn't for the difficulties that I've played on so far. 

Still, I can't wait to see how the game grows as more content gets added in. And even if fights are pretty brief, they're fun for what they are.

Action roguelite + unlock characters + bosses = Play as your favorite Touhou girls through mini stages to unlock features. A refreshing style of gameplay instead of the usual bullet hell for Touhou.

[h1]Follow our curator for similar games[/h1] https://store.steampowered.com/curator/35180752-3-point-play/

This game is Nier Automata combat redone in Unity to make cute Touhou rougelike. 
Honestly 10/10.

It's a very neat and fun game. It's really cool and the combat is interesting. The music is fun, the aesthetic is interesting, and the boss are really good for the most part. For the majority of the time it is interesting seeing what kind of builds you can make. 

That is, until you start getting really into it, The main problem however is that it lacks the variety and interest of a rougelike. If there was a greater focus on the boss fights or more variety of the skills, that could be a huge improvement. The biggest issue is that for each unique skill the skill trees end up being quite shallow and you usually just do your best to recreate the same broken build every run. This is compounded with the fact that every boss and every level is exactly the same each run. You always know that you're going to get Suwako's damage check, you always know the world and dracula cradle are going to be a problem if you don't have stamina, everyone opens with the exact same attack first every time. 

8/12
I really like this game, the combat is fun and easy to learn. There are some things to iron out of course but the game is a ton of fun so far.

Kill things but with either one of the Angry Immortal Girl, Funny Magician, Serious Gardener or that Ronald McDonald vampire girl.
What more could you ask for.

Fun game for its price. Quite a few characters to choose from that each handle differently and bring their own style to combat. You can make runs harder or buff yourself up sometimes, and there's a couple ways to approach bosses whether you feel confident you know all their moves and tells, or just want to play it safe and get through it.

Every character has some method or upgrades to prevent themselves from being starved for health, and I believe melee generates energy for your special more than ranged attacks, so aside from not getting a perfect on bosses, it can feel worthwhile to be risky and try to get in close instead of hanging back all the time for a slower win.

(Though this isn't one of the fangames that lets Mokou get unique revival mechanics, she does still get good health manipulation that can still feel like immortality, so all isn't lost.)

Very worth the price, great example of do more with less. The game concept could be easily expanded with more content, and I wouldn't mind paying more for it!
Very run of the mill roguelike for those who aren't into Touhou. For those that are - you can play as Flandre wielding a huge fuck off flaming sword, thumbs up from me

While I am not much of a fan of Rougelike games, I like this game. I can't believe that this is a Touhou fan game because of its graphical quality. I guess that's the main selling point of the game hehe. It's nice to have Myon as the first playable character because I love Myon. Myon is love, Myon is life. You should hug Myon now!
If you can build up your combo that match your play style , this game will be extremely fun to play.

good game just finish all the seal difficulty... my only request/hope, wish they can add more interaction about the story. because of now after I finish all the level I din't get any interaction about the story and this incident in gensokyo.

Really fun little game. Each characters playstyle is unique and interesting. There's a good amount of content and it does actually get quite challenging in higher difficulties which makes it a lot of fun.

I really hope they eventually add more characters too but the selection they have is already great. Would love to see Mamizou make an appearance!
Surprisingly good considering its price point and it's fun to suplex your enemies, get it now!
Got this game today and I already have to say the mechanics and everything make it so much fun to constantly just keep playing. Very fun game 10/10, 5 stars, would recommend.
While the gameplay is nice, the little encounters before the bosses are really simple and the way you progress is very dependent on if you have high enough dps to kill the bosses over the fodder
Amazing game that flows nicely with the combat. Recommend
Very fun game! Each round takes about 15 ~ 25 min and the action and animation is very enjoyable! Top tier Touhou fan game!
great special effects. The combat is also really fun and the special upgrades are cool.
I don't know what kinda sauce they put in this game, but it's gotta contain at least a little crack

This is an amazing game. The gameplay and graphics are both top notch, I really love playing this. Visual effects, sound effects and animations are great, the characters have great models, theres small details like grass being burnt by fire attacks and strong hits feel impactful without being overdone. Being a touhou fangame, the music is naturally good aswell.
As for the rogue aspect, the talents you get are varied and many of them add or change mechanics, which means that with the same character your gameplay can be very different depending on what you pick. The bosses are a perfect blend of touhou and action, with their signature bullet hell patterns present but also action elements incorporated, each boss being different from the last, and the combat mechanics being challenging but also satisfying, with fluid and intuitive controls. I also just have to say I love Flandres Laevateinn being a greatsword in this, shes just so fun to play.

And bonus points for carrying over progress from the demo!
This is my first touhou game, and I enjoy each of the characters' movesets quite a lot

Beat the hardest difficulty, Game is alright but it's a REALLY bad roguelike. The levels are literally non-existent. Upgrades are 90% stat upgrades and there's zero actual reasons to replay.

Anyways uhhh i'll set it to positive if the dev fixes this but man.

bad game design.

Positives -
- Combat is very fun and fluid
- Nonstop action, runs feel shorter than they are
- Great use of the Touhou world in the character models, music, and attacks

Cons -
- Permanent upgrades are extremely strong

Touhou Dystopian is a very fun and fast roguelite that doesn't waste your time (besides maybe some achievements if you're unlucky). I love how fast-paced gameplay is, enter a room with enemies > get new perk > repeat and fight a boss every 4th floor. The Touhou theme is very loved here with the nice models, music, and attacks that fit each character. Each playable character is fun to play and not too hard to understand.

My only real complaint (which may be a positive to others) is that the permanent upgrades can turn the game into a cakewalk even on the hardest difficulty, bosses can also be a bit spongy on higher difficulties. So if you aren't a fan of gimping yourself or self-imposed challenges you might be a little disappointed, though I would say it doesn't take too much away from the fun even if it is easy.
Incredible fun touhou game. Might have a bit of performing issues here and there, but the concept and the combat are really interesting.
I've gotten less with 60$, also the VRM support is cool.
Actual peak, needs more content but a solid fun hack n slash roguelite, 8/10 bc big Flandre sword
game is fun, performance may not be the greatest but it's fun. diverse gameplay and cute graphics.

Really solid arena beat'em-up
It's a bit simple game really - you pick a character, you go through 2-3 quick stages of sandbag mooks during which you pick new abilities for your build and then you test your build against a minor or major boss. After 3 major bosses are dead you complete the game and unlock a new difficulty. Then you spend the currencies you earned during the run for new unlocks and you repeat that until you clear all difficulties and unlock all the stuff.
Now this simple loop doesn't mean the game is bad. Quite the opposite actually - the combat is absolutely fantastic, it's meaty and crunchy, all the explosion effects and sounds combine together just right to make the hits feal heavy and inpactful.
The semi-random build making for each character feels very good as well, after a while you start noticing all the small design decisions for each character that works perfectly with certain abilities and you really start cranking up some insanely min-maxed builds.
The music is pretty good too, obviously all of the tracks are arranges of classic ZUN themes, bunch of them are really good, some are just ok but I don't think there is a single bad one
Story is... a bit dumb but overall it's completely in the background and doesn't take away from the experience of just beating stuff up.
My biggest complain would be that after a while it gets a bit annoying that all bosses are always in the same order and all inbetween stages are packed with same types of enemies, a bit more randomness in that regard would be welcome, maybe some sort of endless mode where bosses and stages are randomized and you are just trying to go as far as possible. Mind you just because the encounters are non-random doesn't mean they ever get dull or easy, combat is always fun, but more unpredictability would be welcome.
Overall - in my opinion in videogames gameplay is king and this is extremely gameplay-dense videogame. If you don't care about story and just want game with cute 2hus beating each other up this one is really good in that aspect, highly recommended.
This feels like a boss-rush roguelike with the combat movement and mechanics of Neir; Automata. Very polished good game, no complaints. Absolutely worth the price.

wow.. this is ten bucks? This is really REALLY GOOD for any price man but 10 bucks? this feels like im stealing from the dev. Gameplay feels like neir automata combat/action in a small little arena packed full of enemys. beat em up, move on, get more powerful. its simple but its very fun. give it a try holy shit.. i dont think youll regret it.
Touhou fan rejoice, this game is very fun action Roguelite worthy of your time and the price tag. good action, good progression, Flandre is playable and feels really destructive (very important).

i'm a bit biased because i love touhou a whole bunch, it means a lot to me and my girlfriend, but this is genuinely one of the best games i ever played, so much fun and actually insanely addictive. i get on thinking "oh i'll do one run through here for some fun" and then i play for three hours straight.
please buy this. support this amazing developer. i truly hope it continues recieving updates or perhaps even a sequel!!
Good game. Got every achievement. Took me a bit, but it was fun. Hope to see some more updates in the future, but for the price I paid, it was really good!
Surprisingly addictive gameplay and top-notch soundtrack.

Really solid experience, especially if you just like Touhou. Gameplay loop and sound is satisfying, and the visuals are great, plus the music is pretty damn good. Roguelike element is fun, but some skills feel weak or pointless, while others are so good there's not much point not picking them, but that's the only real fault I can think of. Highly recommend, great 3D indie Touhou game 8/10
A top tier roguelike, only complaint is that after a while gets a little repetitive. Going through exact same locations every time dosent feel too great, but isnt as big of a problem as youd think
2hu rougelike action game, mix of souls & nier combat, fun stuff highly recommend
its all Bullet hell until someone decided to stop dodging and just brushed off those multiple projectile with her fist.

Very good and addictive game 
I couldn't sleep before finishing the game which took me 4 hours 
I highly recommend it for Roguelike fans
Truly one of the few roguelike games I found interesting and playful. Well to be honest I have only played like 2 such games......
Very fun hack n slash roguelite. I need someone to make mods so all the mobs get turned into Fumos.

Great game for hack'n'slash and touhou fans to kill some time 
[b] 10 ᗜˬᗜ out of 10 [/b]
cool, i hope there is more content or multiplayer match

A Touhou rogue-lite hack-and-slash spectacle fighter? Friggen yes and yes
4 characters to choose from with each a vastly different combat style? Yes please
Multiple bosses across the Gensokyo universe with solid attack patterns and spell cards? Another tick

A great rogue-lite often features solid replayability thanks to it's variety of abilities that allow multiple builds and experiences
with each run, and injecting that RNG that one must pray to in order to hit those god-rolls to allow you to steam-roll the enemies and feel extra good
Touhou Dystopian definitely has those factors

There isn't much in the story department (although it is techniquely there)
So let's just move onto the combat

The game features 4 playable characters from the Touhou Universe
Youmu, our lovable samurai gardener with two katanas for that extra weeb-point
Flandre, the resident crazy with a giant greatsword and an invulnerability super allowing her to bonk with impunity 
Mokou, the firebender monk class with a Hayabusa Drop and Vegeta-explosion super
and Marisa, the long range artillery masquerading as a magic-girl

There is a standard 1-2-3 basic attack combo, but as you gather up hits, you can unleash a special attack and even your ultimate
Combine that with the perfect-dodge mechanic and the parry system, it just really makes the combat flow smoothly
The combat mechanics appear simple at first, but as you unlock more talents that are unique to the characters the builds really open up
Do you go for the crit-damage charged mega-bonk build with Flan? or impervious build by making her invuln ultimate last longer and be up 90% of the time?
Or both if you've prayed sufficiently to RNGesus

Nothing to do with the game, but I wish I had my proper game play-time recorded
Played it primarily on the steam deck and the sleep-function ruins the exact game time played
[Runs great on the steam deck btw, albeit at 50fps]
I definitely have more than the listed hours thanks to how fun the runs go (I'm gonna guess about 40 to 50 hrs for me to get all achievements)
I almost felt a bit sad and empty knowing that I'm done with the game

For Touhou fans, this is a no-brainer --- Get the game!
For non-Touhou fans, this is DMC rogue-lite with cute girls --- Get the game!

Play Marisa.
Marisa: I cast! I cast! Oh I cast- FUCK YOU! I'M NOT GOING TO ANNOUCE MY FUCKING SPELLS ANYMORE!! Y'ALL WILL FIND OUT WHAT THEY ARE WHEN THEY OBLITERATE THE SHIT OUT OF YOU!

Rogue-like Hack and Slash with Playable Mokou!
Worth the $10 price.
The combat and bossfights are so enjoyable.
Super fun game, definitely worth the price

Mokou playable 10/10
Sagume is in the game (peak)
Just needs to add the secret boss and this would be perfect!
This game is pretty fun I enjoyed it even though my PC can barely run this game it awesome
How many times can I say yes before this text box can't take it anymore? Yes. This game is freakin' awesome.
This game is worth every penny im addicted btw
Very Good it tickles a good part of my brain
Tomorrow will be special, today was not
I like Touhou and 3D action games, so I like this game.
I can turn Youmu into a meatgrinder. 10/10.
My beloved Flan is playable, best touhou fangame ever!
The money isn't gone - It's just taken the form of something you love to stay by your side.
Fun game. Wasn't easy to 100%.

Don't let that Izuna Drop in the trailer fool you. If you're looking for something with the depth of a AAA 3D action game like Ninja Gaiden, you're not gonna get that here. What you will get is a pretty nice controlling action game to waste some hours in, with a nice Touhou paint (the reason why most people will be interested).

The relatively low content offering (as of release) and the lack of real depth to any of the systems apart from the rogue-like randomizations make it hard to justify going back to it after so many playthroughs - an issue which a great deal of games in the rogue-like genre tend to fall into.

That doesn't mean you won't get any enjoyment out of it, because you definitely will. The game has a decent amount of polish and hitting things can be VERY satisfying (Flan or Mokou being the best examples imo). Just know what you're getting yourself into, and temper your expectations going in. You're getting a great game for the price.

negative.review:
The game is fun, but the performance is terrible. This game is listed as "playable" on Steam Deck, but I hardly think that's true. Game drops below 30 quite a bit and it just isn't a stable experience. I had to move over to my home gaming PC to even play this game, and even then I was surprised by the lower than expected performance and how hot it made my 3080.

I think it goes without saying, but this game isn't a looker. It's simply very unoptimized. If they ever fix the performance issues, I'll change my review.

its a neat hack n slash but there is little to no variety and the gameplay is very repetitive. I've unlocked all the difficulty options and it's just number go up as well, gameplay is largely the same.

I don't actively hate the game but it feels like there isn't much to do and the combat is very simple.

I don't actively hate the game but it feels like there isn't much to do and the combat is very simple.

The game is fun, but the performance is terrible. This game is listed as "playable" on Steam Deck, but I hardly think that's true. Game drops below 30 quite a bit and it just isn't a stable experience. I had to move over to my home gaming PC to even play this game, and even then I was surprised by the lower than expected performance and how hot it made my 3080.

I think it goes without saying, but this game isn't a looker. It's simply very unoptimized. If they ever fix the performance issues, I'll change my review.
